entry.title: Combined summary - Forking personal "vanity" versions...
entry.summary: The context discusses the existence of various vanity versions of bitcoin, and author's response to it. The author shares a code for making a unix file for bitcoin, but an error occurs stating that db_cxx.h file cannot be found, resulting in the compilation termination with an error. Alan Grimes participated in a discussion thread and questioned whether there is a 'vanity version' that removes the use of libdb or requires the user to not have its development headers installed on their system. However, it is unclear what exactly he means by 'vanity version'. On July 28, 2011, a conversation occurred between Alan Grimes and Gregory Maxwell regarding the use of libdb in bitcoin. They discussed how to build their own version of Bitcoin. In a forum discussion, Alan Grimes responded with a brief message that said "'nuff said," which frustrated another participant, who suggested keeping such messages to oneself.In another email conversation between Gregory Maxwell and Alan Grimes, the topic of vanity versions of bitcoin is discussed. Grimes argues that there can never be too many vanity versions of bitcoin, to which Maxwell responds by questioning whether there are any vanity versions that remove the use of libdb or require certain development headers not to be installed. The conversation ends with a humorous comment from JS about the possibility of magic build instructions in the readme file.Finally, during a discussion on the bitcoin-development list, Gavin Andresen urged everyone to ask themselves whether their message will help move the bitcoin project forward or just make someone angry before posting. He also advised them to assume that at least one person on the list is in a bad mood due to personal reasons.
